Sentencas: As one of the most important feedstocks, light olefins such as propylene and ethylene have drawn worldwide attention.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and olefin via proton conducting fuel cells using (Pr0.3Sr0.7)0.9Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 catalyst layers

Sentencas: In this work, co-generation of propylene and ethylene with electricity is successfully demonstrated in a propane fueled proton conducting solid oxide fuel cell (P-SOFC) using a novel (Pr0.3Sr0.7)(0.9)Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 (PSNT) catalytic layer, which is applied to preprocess propane fuel.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and olefin via proton conducting fuel cells using (Pr0.3Sr0.7)0.9Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 catalyst layers

Sentencas: Highly dispersive nickel nano-particles are in-situ exsolved from the reduced PSNT catalytic layer, which greatly improve propane conversion rate, and thus depress the anode carbon deposition.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and olefin via proton conducting fuel cells using (Pr0.3Sr0.7)0.9Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 catalyst layers

Sentencas: Importantly, conversion selectivities to propylene and ethylene increase with the current densities, reaching 36 % and 32 %, respectively, at 300 mA cm(-2) and 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and olefin via proton conducting fuel cells using (Pr0.3Sr0.7)0.9Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 catalyst layers

Sentencas: This phenomenon indicates that the intrinsic dehydrogenation reactions in anode of P-SOFC benefit light olefins synthesis.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and olefin via proton conducting fuel cells using (Pr0.3Sr0.7)0.9Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 catalyst layers

Sentencas: Our work demonstrates promising feasibility to co-generate light olefins and electrical power via P-SOFCs, which may shed some new lights on the application of P-SOFCs.
Titulo: Co-generation of electricity and olefin via proton conducting fuel cells using (Pr0.3Sr0.7)0.9Ni0.1Ti0.9O3 catalyst layers
